{"step_by_step_thinking": "The drug of choice for precocious puberty in girls is GnRH analogues. GnRH analogues work by suppressing the release of gonadotropins, which in turn suppresses the production of sex hormones and slows down the progression of puberty. Cyproterone acetate is an antiandrogen and is not typically used for precocious puberty. Danazol is a synthetic androgen and is also not used for precocious puberty. Medroxyprogesterone acetate is a progestin and is not the drug of choice for precocious puberty.", "answer_choice": "A"}
